ratelimiter.config.intro=The rate limiting service provides a way to control how fast users can consume your website content and prevent abusive site grabbing. Through this configuration you can define one or more allow consumption rates for different periods of time. All changes are applied immediately for new visitors, while existing visitors continue with their previous configuration until their next visit or application restart. If you delete all limitations, the service is deactivated for all users immediately. Administrators are not affected by the rate limitation and anonymous users are limited by their IP address. ratelimiter.config.ratelimiters=Configured Rate Limiters ratelimiter.config.livetable.limit=Limit ratelimiter.config.livetable.period=Period ratelimiter.config.livetable.overflow=Overflow ratelimiter.config.livetable.actions= ratelimiter.config.error.norights=You should have admin rights to manage this configuration. ratelimiter.config.livetable.limit.requestper=requests    / ratelimiter.config.livetable.overflow.never=Never ratelimiter.config.livetable.overflow.requests=requests
RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_unit_DAYS=day(s) RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_unit_HOURS=hour(s) RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_unit_MINUTES=minute(s)
RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_limit=Requests limit RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_limit_tooltip=Maximum amount of requests allowed during the given period of time. Requests are strictly equivalent to pages. Loading a page require at least one request, but could generate more request to load images in the page, display attachements, etc... RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_period=Time period RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_period_tooltip=The shifting time period taken into account to enforced the above limit. The effective limitation is not to exceed limit/period requests. RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_overflow=Overflow RateLimiter.RateLimiterConfigClass_overflow_tooltip=Amount of request before incomming request stop to be accounted for the purpose of rate limiting. All requests made in excess that goes over the overflow will be ignored. If empty, all request are accounted infinitely, which could cause increasing waiting time before an acceptable request could be finally allowed. The overflow should be higher or equal to the requests limit.
